resources.string:
Armed Individual
- Get out, hide out, keep out
- When running, leave your belongins behind and keep your hands visible
- If you know where the assiliant is, consider the safest route for escape if possible
- If its usafe to escape:
- Immediately seek protection
- Secure area by locking/barricading doors using whatever available
- If someone has a belt, use it to help barricade double doors by wrapping it around the door knobs
- Stay behind solid objects away from door
- Do not hundle in a group since it makes an easier target
- Minimize noise that may draw attention to the room; turn off lights and machines and silence phones
- Obey the directions of law enforcement who are handling the situation
- Fight only as a very last resort, try and incapacitate the shooter
- Use an object as a weapon like a chair

Medical Emergency
- Stay clear
- If trained in first aid/CPR/autometed external defibrillator (AED) as appropriate
- If not trained, stay clear of area that the emergencies
- Help direct first respoinders to incident location
- Re-enter only when directed to by authorities

Fire
- Activate nearest fire alarm (if not already activated)
- Proceed to the nearest exit
- Use stairs and not the elevator
- Assist persons with disabilities
- Meet at designated assembly areas
- Stay away from building entrances
- Account for individuals
- Re-enter only when directed by authorities

Power Outage
- Secure all experiments, unplug electrical equipment, and shut off research gases
- Fully close fume hoods
- If people are trapped in an elevator, do not pry open elevator doors
- Isolate hazardous areas to prevent harm and/or evacuate buidling as appropriate
- Re-enter area only when directed by authorities

Suspicious Activity
- Always report unusual or supicious activity to OSU Police or to your local law enforcement agency
- Open locked doors for authorized persons only
- Do not touch or disturb unknown or suspicious subjects
- Secure you belongings and assets
- Re-enter area only when directed by authorities

Distressed Individual
- Be aware of the location of the nearest telephone (within the building or a celluar phone)
- If your are concerned for your safety, or that of others, call 911 immediately
- If the individual is causing a disruption to the classroom of the office environment yet does not pose a threat:
- Discuss the situation with the person to address inappropriate behaviour
- Ask the individual to leave the room

Tornado
- Close all doors, including main corridors
- Move to the lowest interior space of the building (windowless hallways, basement, restroom)
- Crouch near floor or under heavy, well supported objects and cover the back of your head
- If outdoors and there is no time to move into an ionterior sapace lie flat in nearest depression (ditch, ravine) and cover back of your head
- Tune to local radio or TV
- Resgister for severe weather alerts at go.osu.edu/weatheralert

Hazardous Materials Release
- Alert people in the immediate area of spill to evacuate
- Avoid breathing vapors from spill
- Unless properly trained, do not attempt to clean up the spill yourself
- If personally contaminated, seek eye wash and/or emergency shower
- Do not operate any electrical devices, phones (including celluar devices), appliances, light switches, or equipment with open flames within spill area
- Re-enter area only when directed by authorities
